description: The developed world's dependence on fossil fuels for energy production has extremely undesirable economic, environmental, and political consequences, and is likely to be mankind's greatest challenge in the 21st century. We describe the physical principles of energy, its production and consumption, and environmental consequences, including the greenhouse effect. We will examine a number of alternative modes of energy generation - fossil fuels, biomass, wind, solar, hydro, and nuclear - and study the physical and technological aspects of each, and their societal, environmental and economic impacts over the construction and operational lifetimes. No previous study of physics is assumed.
name: ENERGY,OIL&GLOBAL WARMIN

values.comments:
This course explores the physical principles of energy, its production and consumption, and environmental consequences, including the greenhouse effect. Students will examine a number of alternative modes of energy generation - fossil fuels, biomass, wind, solar, hydro, and nuclear - and study the physical and technological aspects of each, and their societal, environmental and economic impacts over the construction and operational lifetimes. No previous study of physics is assumed.

Students found that the course “completely lacked any structure whatsoever.” It was “not organized at all,” making it “very difficult to learn the material and do well on the test.” The lectures “in no way reflected the exam,” and lectures had too many slides.

Professor Lande “is very smart and very knowledgeable, but he is not the most enthusiastic teacher, nor is [he] the best lecturer.” He “does not speak very loudly,” making it hard to follow the lectures. Students wished he had assigned more homework and better explained his expectations. Some did think that he conveyed complicated material in a simple manner, however.

Students felt that exams were difficult to prepare for due to a lack of practice problems and reading assignments. This course fulfills the Natural Sciences and Mathematics sector.
